briefdescription.para: Successful status code returned by I2S driver functions.

detaileddescription.para: I2S driver functions return I2S_ALL_TRANSACTION_SUCCESS if ALL the queued transactions were executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Successful status code returned by I2S driver functions.

detaileddescription.para: I2S driver functions return I2S_TRANSACTION_SUCCESS if ONE queued transaction was executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Error status code returned by I2S driver functions.

detaileddescription.para: I2S driver functions return I2S_TIMEOUT_ERROR if I2S module lost the audio clock. If this error has been raised, I2S module must be reseted and restarted.

briefdescription.para: Error status code returned by I2S driver functions.

detaileddescription.para: I2S driver functions return I2S_BUS_ERROR if I2S module faced problem with the DMA bus (DMA transfer not completed in time). If this error has been raised, I2S module must be reseted and restarted.

briefdescription.para: Error status code returned by I2S driver functions.

detaileddescription.para: I2S driver functions return I2S_WS_ERROR if I2S module detect noise on the WS signal. If this error has been raised, I2S module must be reseted and restarted.

briefdescription.para: Error status code returned by I2S driver functions.

detaileddescription.para: I2S driver functions return I2S_PTR_READ_ERROR if I2S module ran out of data on the read interface (DMA pointer not loaded in time). If this error has been raised, I2S module must be reseted and restarted.

briefdescription.para: Error status code returned by I2S driver functions.

detaileddescription.para: I2S driver functions return I2S_PTR_WRITE_ERROR if I2S module ran out of data on the write interface (DMA pointer not loaded in time). If this error has been raised, I2S module must be reseted and restarted.
Buffer used is 8 bits length. Not available for CC26XX.
Buffer used is 16 bits length.
Buffer used is 24 bits length.
Buffer used is 32 bits length. Not available for CC26XX.

briefdescription.para: I2S slot memory length setting.

detaileddescription.para: The enum defines if the module uses a 16 bits or a 24 bits buffer in memory. This value has no influence on the number of bit transmitted.
Module is a slave, clocks are externally generated.
Module is a master, clocks are internally generated.

briefdescription.para: I2S master / slave selection.

detaileddescription.para: The enum defines if the module acts like a master (clocks are internally generated) or a slave (the clocks are externally generated).
Sampling on falling edges.
Sampling on rising edges.

briefdescription.para: I2S sampling setting.

detaileddescription.para: The enum defines if sampling is done on BLCK rising or falling edges.
Single phase
Dual phase

briefdescription.para: I2S phase setting.

detaileddescription.para: The enum defines if the I2S if set with single or dual phase.
SD0 is disabled
SD0 is an input
SD0 is an output
SD1 is disabled
SD1 is an input
SD1 is an output

briefdescription.para: I2S data interface configuration.

detaileddescription.para: The enum defines the different settings for the data interfaces (SD0 and SD1).
No channel activated
MONO: only channel one is activated
MONO INVERERTED: only channel two is activated
STEREO: channels one and two are activated
1 channel is activated
2 channels are activated
3 channels are activated
4 channels are activated
5 channels are activated
6 channels are activated
7 channels are activated
8 channels are activated
All the eight channels are activated

briefdescription.para: Channels used selection.

detaileddescription.para: The enum defines different settings to activate the expected channels.

briefdescription.para: A handle that is returned from a I2S_open() call.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* I2S_Callback) (I2S_Handle handle, int_fast16_t status, I2S_Transaction *transactionPtr)
memberdef.name: I2S_Callback

briefdescription.para: The definition of a user-callback function used by the I2S driver.

parameterdescription.para: Status of the operation (possible values are : :I2S_STATUS_SUCCESS, :I2S_STATUS_ERROR, :I2S_STATUS_BUFFER_UNAVAILABLE, :I2S_STATUS_TIMEOUT)
*transactionPtr: Pointer on the transaction that has just started. For error callbacks, transactionPtr points on NULL.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* I2S_RegUpdate) (uint32_t ui32Base, uint32_t ui32NextPointer)
memberdef.name: I2S_RegUpdate

briefdescription.para: The definition of a function used to set the I2S register.

parameterdescription.para: ui32Base: base address of the I2S module.
ui32NextPointer: pointer on an I2S buffer.

briefdescription.para: The definition of a function used to stop an I2S interface.
Default I2S_Params structure.
Function to close a given I2S peripheral specified by the I2S handle.

simplesect.para: I2S_open() had to be called first.

briefdescription.para: Function to initializes the I2S module.

simplesect.para: The I2S_config structure must exist and be persistent before this function can be called. This function must also be called before any other I2S driver APIs. This function call does not modify any peripheral registers.

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize a given I2S peripheral specified by the particular index value. The parameter specifies which mode the I2S will operate.

parameterdescription.para: Logical peripheral number for the I2S indexed into the I2S_config table
Pointer to an parameter block. All the fields in this structure are RO (read-only). Provide a NULL pointer cannot open the module.

simplesect.para: An I2S_Handle on success or a NULL on an error or if it has been opened already.

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize the I2S_Params struct to its defaults.
Initialize an I2S_Transaction struct to known state.

detaileddescription.para: The I2S_Transaction struct is put in a known state. The application is still responsible for populating some of the fields. For example, the user is responsible to provide the buffer containing the data and the size of it. User provided buffer's size must matche with the I2S settings. If the buffer size is not adapted, the I2S module will truncate it. Authorized buffer sizes depend on the number of activated outputs, the number of channels activated, the memory slots length (16 or 24 bits), and the fixed-buffer-size eventually provided. Authorized buffer sizes are all the multiple values of the value of handle->object->memoryStepOut.

briefdescription.para: Function to set the first read-transaction to consider.

detaileddescription.para: At the end of each transaction, I2S driver takes in consideration the next transaction. Application is responsible to handle the queue.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an I2S_Transaction object. The bufPtr and bufSize fields must be set to a buffer and the size of the buffer before passing to this function.

briefdescription.para: Function to set the first write-transaction to consider.

detaileddescription.para: At the end of each transaction, I2S driver takes in consideration the next transaction. Application is responsible to handle the queue.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an I2S_Transaction object. The bufPtr and bufSize fields must be set to a buffer and the size of the buffer before passing to this function.

briefdescription.para: Start the WS, SCK and MCLK clocks.

detaileddescription.para: This function enable WS, SCK and MCLK (if activated) clocks. This is required before starting any reading or a writing transaction. This function is supposed to be executed both in slave and master mode.

briefdescription.para: Stops the WS, SCK and MCLK clocks.

detaileddescription.para: This function disable WS, SCK and MCLK clocks. This function must be executed only if no transaction is in progress. This function is supposed to be executed in a Task context (NOT in a HWI or Callback context). This function is supposed to be executed both in slave and master mode.

simplesect.para: This function is supposed to be executed in a Task context (NOT in a HWI or Callback context).

briefdescription.para: Start read transactions.

detaileddescription.para: This function starts reception of the transactions stored in the read-queue. and returns immediately. At the completion of each transaction the readCallback provided is executed.

If the queue for read transactions becomes empty (i.e. the read Callback is triggered with status I2S_ALL_TRANSACTIONS_SUCCESS and the application has not queued new transactions or defined a new first read-transaction to consider using I2S_setReadQueueHead()), the driver will stop the read interface on its own in order to avoid the occurrence of errors (such as I2S_PTR_READ_ERROR).

simplesect.para: First read-transaction to consider must be set and clocks must be running before calling this function.

briefdescription.para: Start write transactions.

detaileddescription.para: This function starts transmission of the transactions stored in the write-queue and returns immediately. At the completion of each transaction the write Callback provided is executed.

If the queue for write transactions becomes empty (i.e. the write Callback is triggered with status I2S_ALL_TRANSACTIONS_SUCCESS and the application has not queued new transactions or defined a new first write-transaction to consider using I2S_setWriteQueueHead()), the driver will stop the write interface on its own in order to avoid the occurrence of errors (such as I2S_PTR_WRITE_ERROR).

simplesect.para: First write-transaction to consider must be set and clocks must be running before calling this function.

briefdescription.para: Stop read transactions.

detaileddescription.para: This function stops the reception of read transactions correctly so that read operations can be safely restarted later.

The application can decide at any time to suspend the reception of data by calling this function. In this case (and because the transaction queue is not empty) the execution of I2S_stopRead() is blocked until the current transaction is completed (this ensures that the I2S read interface is correctly stopped). Therefore, this function must be executed in a Task context (not in a HWI or Callback context).

After the transfers have been stopped (either by calling I2S_stopRead() or because the queue has been empty), the application can resume the transfers using the function I2S_startRead(). If the read-queue was empty application must beforehand set the first read-transaction using I2S_setReadQueueHead().

briefdescription.para: Stop write transactions.

detaileddescription.para: This function stops the transmission of write transactions correctly so that writing operations can be safely restarted later.

The application can decide at any time to suspend the sending of data by calling this function. In this case (and because the transaction queue is not empty) the execution of I2S_stopWrite() is blocked until the current transaction is completed (this ensures that the I2S write interface is correctly stopped). Therefore, this function must be executed in a Task context (not in a HWI or Callback context).

After the transfers have been stopped (either by calling I2S_stopWrite() or because the queue has been empty), the application can resume the transfers using the function I2S_startWrite(). If the write-queue was empty application must beforehand set the first write-transaction using I2S_setWriteQueueHead().

briefdescription.para: Inter-Integrated Circuit Sound (I2S) Bus Driver.

detaileddescription.para: The I2S header file should be included in an application as follows: #include<ti/drivers/I2S.h>

The I2S driver facilitates the use of Inter-IC Sound (I2S), which is used to connect digital audio devices so that audio signals can be communicated between devices. The I2S driver simplifies reading and writing to any of the Multichannel Audio Serial Port (McASP) peripherals on the board with Receive and Transmit support. These include read and write characters on the McASP peripheral.

I2S interfaces typically consist of 4 or 5 signals. The 5th signal is not systematically used.
Serial Clock (SCK) also called Bit Clock (BCLK) or Multichannel Audio Frame Synchronization (McAFSX)
Word Select (WS) also called Word Clock (WCLK), Left Right Clock (LRCLK) or Multichannel Audio Clock (McACLK)
Serial Data (SD0) also called AD0, AD1, McAXR0, or possibly SDI
Serial Data (SD1) also called AD1, ADI, McAXR1, or possibly SDI
Master Clock (MCLK)
Usage

para.bold: The I2S driver provides the following APIs:

listitem.para: I2S_init(): Function to initializes the I2S module.
I2S_open(): Function to initialize a given I2S peripheral specified by the particular index value. The parameter specifies which mode the I2S will operate.
I2S_Params_init(): Function to initialize the I2S_Params struct to its defaults.
I2S_Transaction_init(): Initialize an I2S_Transaction struct to known state.
I2S_setReadQueueHead(): Function to set the first read-transaction to consider.
I2S_setWriteQueueHead(): Function to set the first write-transaction to consider.
I2S_startClocks(): Start the WS, SCK and MCLK clocks.
I2S_stopClocks(): Stops the WS, SCK and MCLK clocks.
I2S_close(): Function to close a given I2S peripheral specified by the I2S handle.

para.heading: Transactions

detaileddescription.para:
Data transfers are achieved through I2S_Transaction structures. Application is responsible to maintain the transactions queues. The I2S driver completes the transactions one by one. When a transaction is over, the I2S driver takes in consideration the next transaction (if the next transaction is NULL, the I2S drivers signals this to the user). The I2S driver relies on the following fields of the I2S_Transaction to complete it:
the buffer
the length of the buffer
a pointer on the next transaction to achieve (kept in a List_Elem structure) The I2S driver provides the following elements (fields of the I2S_Transaction):
the number of untransferred bytes: the driver is designed to avoid memory corruption and will not complete an incomplete transaction (meaning a transaction where the buffer size would not permit to send or receive a whole number of samples). In this case, the system considers the samples of the beginning of the buffer and read/write as much as possible samples and ignore the end of the buffer. The number of untransafered bytes is the number of bytes left at the end of the buffer)
the number of completions of the transaction. This value is basically incremented by one every time the transaction is completed.
Please note that these two fields are valid only when the transaction has been completed. Consult examples to get more details on the transaction usage.

para.heading: Providing data to the I2S driver

detaileddescription.para: Application is responsible to handle the queues of transactions. Application is also responsible to provide to the driver a pointer on the first transaction to consider (considering that all the following transactions are correctly queued). I2S_setReadQueueHead() and I2S_setWriteQueueHead() allow the user to set the first transaction to consider. These functions should be used only when no transaction is running on the considered interface.

para.heading: Start and stop clocks and transactions

detaileddescription.para:
Clocks can be started and stopped by the application. Read and write can be started and stopped independently. To start a transfer, clocks must be running. To stop the clocks no transfer must be running. Refer to the following functions for more details:
I2S_startClocks()
I2S_startRead()
I2S_startWrite()
I2S_stopRead()
I2S_stopWrite()
I2S_stopClocks()
In I2S_SLAVE mode, clocks must be started and stopped exactly like it is done in I2S_MASTER mode.
If the queue of transaction is not empty, the calls to I2S_stopRead() and I2S_stopWrite() are blocking and potentially long.
Examples
The following example shows how to simultaneously receive and send out a given amount of data.

simplesect.para: If you desire to put only one transaction in the queue, fixedBufferLength must be inferior to half the length (in bytes) of the buffer to transfer.

para.heading: Writing Data in Continuous Streaming Mode

detaileddescription.para: The following example shows how to read and write data in streaming mode. A dummy treatment of the data is also done. This example is not complete (semaphore and tasks creation are not shown)

The following example shows how to read and write data in repeat mode. The same buffers are continuously written and send out while the driver is not stopped. Here, we decide to only stop sending out after an arbitrary number of sending.

simplesect.para: In the case of circular lists, there is no problem to put only one buffer in the queue.

detaileddescription.para: Refer to the Driver's Configuration section for driver configuration information.
